15:10 <tvtwo> has joined #xwiki  
15:11 <tvtwo> hello all  
15:14 <tvtwo> I am new with xwiki and also to tomcat in common. how can I make sure that the postgres jdbc driver is going to be replaced when I do a yum update (on centos linux) ? The documentation say "just copy the jar file in the lib dir of WEB-INF or the serverlet containers lib dir". thats probably not updated then.  
15:14 <tvtwo> is it possible to use symlinks?  
15:18 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
15:19 <woshilapin> has quit  
15:40 <vmassol> has quit  
16:00 <tvtwo> has quit  
16:24 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
16:24 <boubou> hi guys  
16:24 <boubou> I did  
16:24 <boubou> mysql -u root -e "create database xwiki default character set utf8 collate utf8\_bin"  
16:24 <boubou> mysql -u root -e "grant all privileges on \*.\* to xwiki@localhost identified by 'xwiki'"  
16:25 <boubou> cd /var/lib/tomcat/webapps/xwikienterprise80/WEB-INF/lib/  
16:25 <boubou> wget https://downloads.mariadb.com/enterprise/mpbj-q1d9/connectors/java/connector-java-1.4.3/mariadb-java-client-1.4.3.jar  
16:25 <boubou> I deployed the xwikientreprise8.0  
16:27 <boubou> When I try to access my xwiki, I got this error  
16:27 <boubou> http://pastebin.com/1xn9e8mp  
16:27 <ClemensR> org.hibernate.HibernateException: Could not create a DBCP pool. There is  an error in the Hibernate configuration file, please review it.  
16:27 <ClemensR> java.sql.SQLException: Cannot load JDBC driver class 'org.hsqldb.jdbcDriver'  
16:28 <ClemensR> you should type in the proper name for the driver class in hibernate.cfg.xml  
16:29 <ClemensR> there is a mysql-section in that file ... commment out the active part, and comment in the mysql part, and update what need update in your settings  
16:30 <boubou> can I use mariadb-java-client-1.4.3.jar as jdbc driver ?  
16:33 <ClemensR> I never tried, but it might work  
16:34 <boubou> I put the file in cd /var/lib/tomcat/webapps/xwikienterprise80/WEB-INF/lib/  
16:34 <ClemensR> you need to find out the driver class name, it is probably different from the mysql driver  
16:34 <boubou> is it ok ?  
16:34 <mflorea> has quit  
16:34 <ClemensR> yes, that is ok  
16:34 <boubou> <property name="connection.driver\_class">com.mysql.jdbc.Driver</property>  
16:34 <boubou> that ?  
16:34 <ClemensR> yes, that one  
16:50 <lkrejci> has quit  
16:51 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
16:55 <boubou> Using external pool  
16:56 <boubou> ;)  
16:57 <boubou> GITTT IT!  
16:57 <boubou> GOT\*  
16:59 <ClemensR> ah, ok :)  
17:03 <boubou> ClemensR Wiki is installing... I install Flavor...etc...What will be the next step if I want to restore my data from xwiki 7.0.1  
17:03 <boubou> Just restore the db ?  
17:05 <ClemensR> the db and the contents of the "permanentDir"  
17:06 <ClemensR> it is described here:   http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Backup#HBackupPermanentData    make a backup fro the old instance and restore it in the new instance  
17:07 <ClemensR> hm, restore only handles the DB case, but you will have to restore the stuff from the file system, too  
17:08 <boubou> I know this procedure  
17:08 <boubou> I will have to try it  
17:17 <ClemensR> if you do not copy over the permDir from the file system, XWiki will not upgrade the UI from 7.x to 8.0, and some stuff might look broken  
17:57 <fca> has quit

22:33 <lanouettea\_> has joined #xwiki  
22:34 <lanouettea\_> Hello, I just installed XWiki for the first time and cannot search for extensions. Using the extension manager, if I enter anytihng in the search field and press enter, I end up on a page with the message "The requested page could not be found."  
22:36 <lanouettea\_> Any suggestions on how I should install extensions?
